com.basho.riak.client.api.commands

Class ChunkedResponseIterator<FinalT,ChunkT extends Iterable<CoreT>,CoreT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basho.riak.client.api.commands.ChunkedResponseIterator<FinalT,ChunkT,CoreT>
  • Type Parameters:
    FinalT - The final converted type that this class exposes as part of its iterator.
    ChunkT - The type of the response chunks, contains an Iterable<CoreT>
    CoreT - The raw response type, will get converted to FinalT.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<FinalT>

    public class ChunkedResponseIterator<FinalT,ChunkT extends Iterable<CoreT>,CoreT>
extends Object
implements Iterator<FinalT>
    Transforms a stream of response chunks to a Iterable of response items. When iterating over this class's Iterator this class will lazily walk through the response chunks's iterators and convert the items. It will also wait for more response chunks if none are available. Since this class polls for new "streaming" data, it is advisable to check Thread.isInterrupted() while using this class's Iterator in environments where thread interrupts must be obeyed.
    Since:
    2.1.0
    Author:
    Alex Moore , Sergey Galkin

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next() would return an element rather than throwing an exception.) This method will block and wait for more data if none is immediately available. Riak Java Client Note: Since this class polls for new "streaming" data, it is advisable to check Thread.isInterrupted() in environments where thread interrupts must be obeyed.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface Iterator<FinalT>
        Returns:
        true if the iteration has more elements

      • getContinuation

        public BinaryValue getContinuation()
        Returns the current value of the continuation. Only run this once the operation is complete, or else you will get a null value.
        Returns:
        The continuation value (if any).

      • next

        public FinalT next()
        Returns the next element in the iteration. This method will block and wait for more data if none is immediately available. Riak Java Client Note: Since this class polls for new "streaming" data, it is advisable to check Thread.isInterrupted() in environments where thread interrupts must be obeyed.
